meanings.def: the official home of a king, queen, president, etc.
examples: He spent his early days at the Palace of Versailles.
She found it hard to adjust to palace life.
The king was deposed by his son in a palace coup.

meanings.def: a way of referring to the people who live or work in a palace, especially the British royal family and their advisers
examples: The Palace last night refused to comment on the reports.
The Old Town has a whole collection of churches, palaces and mosques.
Even this small house was a veritable palace compared to his tent.

meanings.def: a large public building, such as a hotel or cinema
